intro: Chamissoa acuminata var. acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and drought tolerance. Chamissoa acuminata var. acuminata is also noted for its ability to thrive in coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers.
